<snip>
| From: Countess Bathory D'Allatu
|
| The other day a level 14 warrior messaged me and tried
| to get me to buy a DF Helm.
|
| Need i say more?
|

<Snip>

NO!
Brian, please tell the admins at Verant to make all class specific armor NO
DROP again! This was one of the few quests in the game that my Troll was
looking forward to aquiring HIMSELF! I don't care how long it takes me to
get a complete set, I am going to get it all myself, without help (ie buying
it from another player) except from my guild members whom storm the dungeons
with me and help me get what I need. Having to get all the items myself to
get armor that was meant for my character added MISSING elements to
Everquest... Roleplaying, Teamwork, and FUN.
I want that back.
Sorry Brian, I am not attacking you, just venting frustration. And hoping my
voice will be heard by those who changed it in the first place.


This brings up other topics that have bugged me for quite a while. Get ready
for a RANT!



Ok, here goes.
Last night someone with the Flaming Paladin sword (Firey Avenger?) and a
Barbarian were in Nektulos Forrest bashing on the guards at the bridge.
After killing 2, another roamed by and attacked them. I'm sorry, but anyone
who just bashes guards for the fun of it is a loser! So, I looted the body
of one guard (I was playing my Rogue at the time) to keep the losers from
gaining anymore than they had already.
A 1st level female SK was watching and said "Let them loot their kills. It
is the honorable thing to do."
I said "I will not stand around and let anyone profit from killing our
guards if I can help it. If I was strong enough, I would have punched a
guard to get it to follow me, collected a few and trained then into these
2."
She said "by right of conquest, they earned what was on those guards."
I said "I don't care. #1, I'm a rogue. I steal to make my living. #2, they
are of the Light and invading my homeland, and I have more of a right to
slight them in anyway I can while in my domain. #3, you are a Shadow Knight
that is forsaking her god, and her people by siding with them."
She did not reply, but Mr Avenger said: "You can come kill our guards if you
like. I do. lol"
I said "I plan on it. And that makes you a traitor to your people and to
your god as well. Neither of you are worthy of your gods!"
I was so fed up I logged off immediately.

It just struck me wrong all the greed that goes on in this game. I do not
agree that every DE that is created has the principles of Drizzt Do`Urden
(spelling?) and travels the lands with those of the Light, yet also returns
home anytime they want without penalty. Dark Elves would no longer be
feared and loathed if this were true. I am a firm believer in the RP aspect
of this game. If you choose and evil race/class, play it the way it was
meant. Granted, unless you solo, you will beforced most of the time to group
with good races, but the dynamics of the game require it sometimes.
Afterall, DE Clerics don't grow on trees. In these situations, the
character is using those of the light and their kind hearts.
Anyone else fed up with the garbage that happens and is accepted as a way of
life besides me? This is upsetting me very much and I honestly cannot figure
out how to put it into words.


AND

A 1st level DE SK cam up to my 5th level rogue and said "Can you give me
some stuff? You know: money, or armor, etc."
I said "ROTFLMAO! Your joking right?" I then proceeded to Hide/Sneak away
from his sorry a$$.

I cannot stand Whiney, beggers that EXPECT you to just give them the banded
off your back!
I have given away plenty of stuff. my TSK has given away a complete set of
Mesh armor, a Woven Tunic, and a Cracked Staff to a newbie mage that helped
me out as a thank you. I would have died in a nasty spot if they hadn't
helped me. They didn't ask or expect anything. When they asked how they
could repay me, I said to help her dark brothers and sister like you did me.
GREED! AK!
Evil is ok. Heh. But the extent to which blatant abuse of the "GIMMIE,
GIMMIE" rule is disgusting. I do not ask for anything of my hello players
except a pleasant RP atmosphere. Some people just don't get it. I will
accept gifts. Generally these gifts have been within the normal level range
for my characters. The biggest thing that I would have no chance in the PoF
of getting were the Blackened Gauntlets my rogue has. This was from my
guild leader as I had absolutley no armor and my newbie dagger.

AND

The XP penalty thing. Why on Norrath do TSKs get a 60% XP penalty? (this
trusts the earlier post that mentioned this is correct) Even in AD&D, a DE
gets a what 25% race penalty, and most kits also have a -10% penalty? I
think this is correct. Feel free to let me know otherwise. =) True, this
in not AD&D, but that 60% scenerio is a bit steep IMHO. I do not agree that
just because I chose to be Evil that it should take me, or anyone else over
twice as long to level when our opposites (Paladins) have basically the same
abilities and limits not counting HT or Complete Heal. That factor alone
unbalances the game. If the game is biased against those of an evil
alignment, put it in plain English how. If it already is, can you show me
where? I have put alot of time and effert into my TSK, and I enjoy playing
him. It makes me sad to think that just because I am evil that the gods of
Verant punish me so in XP when everyplace else in the world they have
created is also biased against me (kos).
In spite of all this I will continue to RP my TSK and have fun. I am not
really out to be a Powergamer. I like the RP aspect very much, though it it
is also very lacking. However, the people I adventure with are passing me
up, and quickly. Pretty soon, I will not be able to adventure with them as I
will draw more creatures to the group and die more often. You all have
probably seen this type of thing before, or even had it happen to you. If
you figured a way around this, plz let me know.
Thank you.


Sorry for the long rant, but I needed to get that out after last nights
Bu!!$h!t

--
Setekh <Dark Omen>
